Their friendliness, responsiveness, and professionalism was beyond what I could have imagined. The ability to customize the home and the “selection” meeting offered more options than I could have ever hoped for, which allowed us to truly make our home “ours.”

Our project manager, Mitchell Beers kept us regularly updated- both via scheduled weekly online updates through the homeowner portal and extra updates during the week via text message when a major event happened. He was responsive to any question, issue, concern etc as it arose, and truly made the process fun.

The quality of the finished product was outstanding and their commitment to delivering and standing by a home that you can be proud of was impressive.

I hope we never need another house because we love ours so much, but if we do, Holland Homes will be the first people I call. Can not recommend enough.

name: kaleigh b
text:
My fiancé and I lived at LeCraw on 13th for two years, beginning when we were both still in school. We were first-time renters and were so excited to get to live in apartment that, to us, was really nice and affordable in a great location. We loved living at LeCraw. Despite the bug problem that we could never seem to get rid of, and the fact that our unit was the only one that didn’t get renovated before we moved in, we truly enjoyed our time there.

We moved out April 13, 2018. Before our final inspection, Jessy Garver at the Thayer Properties office at the Village on Cherokee told us not to worry about being present at the inspection. She told us that if we didn’t hear anything, we were good to go – her exact words (and we have a voice mail of her saying this) were “no news is good news.” We did not hear anything from Jessy or any other member of Thayer staff, because we left the apartment in good condition.

On April 30, we received a letter from Thayer Properties informing us that they were keeping our security deposit and that we owed an additional $288.32 for a bug infestation and carpet replacement. We immediately tried to contact Jessy and the Thayer office and were ignored.  We sent a letter registered mail (so we would get a receipt when they received it), which said that we disputed the debt and needed some documentation proving that the damages were a) as extensive as they claimed, and b) our fault. (Side note: Georgia state law mandates that if a landlord intends to keep a tenant’s security deposit and/or charge them for damages, all inspections and a final list of damages must be compiled within 5 days of the tenant moving out. By the time we were informed of the “damages,” more than two weeks had passed and a new tenant had been moved in. In addition, the statement we were sent was dated April 23 – I’ll save you the math: that’s 10 days after we moved out.) After they received the letter, we were told that all further inquiries should be directed to their lawyer, Travis Hargrove at the Finley Firm. We immediately tried to contact Travis; during our first call, Travis told us he was in his car and couldn’t answer any of our questions because he didn’t have any of the paperwork in front of him. He said he would call us back from his office first thing the next morning.

We never heard back from Travis. His office staff told us that he was in a meeting or mediation every time we called (we made seven attempts to call him in a single week), and when we emailed him, he said that he was on vacation and would contact us when he returned. I bet you can guess what happened next.

On May 24, my fiancé and I each received a letter from National Credit Systems informing us that our debt had been sold and we now owed the collection agency. We sent letters back right away informing them that we disputed the debt and wanted proof: a record of the Knox Pest Control inspection that LeCraw said they ordered, proof that we damaged the carpet beyond reasonable wear, etc. We heard nothing from the debt collector or LeCraw/Thayer or Travis Hargrove for about a month. On July 19, I received a letter from National Credit Systems that said our account had been cancelled because LeCraw/Thayer was unable to provide documentation proving that we owed the debt.

While this was all going on, I spoke to some of our friends who also lived in Thayer-owned properties (one at Hilcrest and one at the Village on Cherokee, both also college students and first-time renters), and what do you know – they were both contacted post move-out that they owed exorbitant amounts of money for damages (with no proof) and carpet replacement.

TLDR: Thayer Properties is running a scam on college students and first-time renters. Living there is pretty great, but once you move out, they will accuse you of damaging the unit and will demand you pay for carpet replacement, but they will have no documentation or proof of the damages. It is NOT worth it.

They removed the storm doors on the back doors. They installed cheap VCT tile and did not seal it. They do not have air conditioning or heat in  complex laundry room & their tenants are disabled and or elderly. name: Taylor Copeland
text:
Loved my home buying team but the actual company Davidson Homes needs to improve in a couple areas. First and most importantly, The HOA board or staff needs to work on professionalism and handling situations case by case. It clearly states in the covenants that fences will not be brought forward except in special circumstances. They would not even discuss my case, just redirected me back to the covenants like I hadn’t already read them. Plus, most of the time, a fence is for privacy. I could care less about the right side of my home, but not being able to have my son’s bedroom window inside the fence for security and privacy reasons is crazy to me.
The other thing I would greatly recommend is improving the design center/appointment. A design room where we can see EVERYTHING, and not the just basic options, would cut down on the confusion and disappointment after the home is finished. I was blindly choosing things I wouldn’t have if I could’ve seen what I was choosing before hand. A full design center with every option available visible to the buyer would help a lot.
I love my home. There are major things I would do differently next time around, but overall, the quality of my home is excellent and my team was exceptional. I loved my community manager and project manager Ryan and Logan. They were the best of the best.

name: Katelyn G
text:
Updating my final review of Davidson Homes despite their attempt to have me sign a disclosure that I will no longer say anything negative about their company since they fixed the issues. This paper also stated that since they are committed to excellent customer service that they would cover "cosmetic" items not normally covered. It should be very clearly stated that the items were not cosmetic and actually a manufacturing defect that never should have been approved by their supers. After nearly 10 months of owning the house, our 60 day warranty items are finally resolved. Summary of issues that are now fixed --leaking chimney that caused severe damage upstairs and downstairs (took 7 months to be tarp free), water intrusion in the garage (claimed to not be considered a defect despite not being present in any other homes), cracked/misaligned window/door casings, manufacturer defect on marble vanity top that was supposed to be replaced before move in (attempted to not cover because it's "cosmetic").

My biggest frustration with them still reigns true despite the thorough completion by Chris Thompson--the amount of time and effort it took to get these things resolved is excessive and shouldn't have been necessary. The (majority of) representatives within Davidson have been friendly throughout the process including Ana Siersma, Chris Thompson, and Chad Vader. Although their production manager could use some people skills and learn to accept that in an instance such as this, the customer has every right to complain without being argued with; or without being met with rebuttals or attempted justification for all the issues or an attempt to silence their right to review. The good news for new homebuyers is that there are new managers in all departments and they will likely never need to personally interact with the production manager, but this unfortunately didn't make it any easier for all of the existing homeowners and I won't personally be able to speak on that. It may seem like I'm holding a grudge or I keep bringing up issues they fixed, and truthfully I should be allowed given the severe damage, unusability of our living spaces, and headache caused with the excessive timeline of repairs; but it's not just us with issues, I have yet to speak to a neighbor who has not had major frustrations with Davidson. So yes, I am happy that our issues are fixed, but there's no way to get rid of the bitter taste given the disaster that we were presented. However, according to a particular production manager and management who presented what can only be described as a non-disclosure since Davidson agreed to fix issues not ordinarily covered under warranty, the repairs are made so I should stop complaining. And yes, everyone has apologized profusely (some with "buts" attached to it) but that didn't change the outcome. And doesn't eliminate snarky comments such as "this is why you have a home warranty" or "you wouldn't have been able to close on time if these were identified before". Difference is, if we didn't close on time, it's not me, the customer, losing money having to pay a mortgage, it's Davidson.

The one thing that has been brought up multiple times (including our final meeting) that is one of my biggest annoyances is that we signed off on a preclose walkthrough stating there weren't the issues we're now pointing out. Our options on walkthrough were to accept that they're saying the work they did was satisfactory or not close on time. There was no in between, compromise, or room to question their work. It's not a good business practice to put homeowners in that situation and it's also worse that no one's really owned up to knowing/acknowledging that is an area of improvement and would rather argue the point. Maybe I have too high of standards coming from Florida where you don't have to choose the best of the worst which is what Huntsville/Madison is (not just me who has these sentiments, I promise). I hope that we can now enjoy owning this home because I really do l love our floorplan.

resp.text:
Hi Katelyn,

We apologize that you feel your experience with us has been anything less than excellent. Your concerns have been brought to the attention of division leadership. If you have any further concerns, please email us directly at CustomerCare@davidsonhomesllc.com.

name: Daphne Zeigler
text:
All Concerned,

We still have the issue in our master bed/bathroom. We’ve battled through this issue the entire summer and it continues today. I’m tired of Davidson sending people over here who don’t know anymore about the issue or resolving the issue than we do. We cannot and will not continue to have our AC down to 69• or lower to accommodate our room when it causes the rest of our downstairs to feel like an icebox.

We’re not sure what was done incorrectly but we do know that something is obviously wrong and we’re not sure why Davidson is not staying on top of the issue until it’s resolved. We shouldn’t have to keep contacting you all when you know that there’s been no resolution.  Here it is at 0400 in the morning and I’m awakened because of the uncomfortable, hot and muggy temperature in our bedroom as the remainder of the house is significantly cooler. The disparity is much more than just a few degrees difference from one room to the other.

We don’t need anyone else to come here and to basically tell us that this is just how it is and this is normal because it’s not! We’ve withstood 100 plus degree weather for several months at a time in our house in Texas (temperatures were extreme) and never had this to happen. The temperature was significantly the same from one level of our house to the next; one room to the next. Similar square footage.

Davidson’s gotten away with putting terrible sod down in our yard and never watering or treating it but this will not be overlooked. We’ve watched each and everyone of our neighbors yards get treated with the proper, upmost care for weeks at a time while we’ve dealt with stony, brick laid horrible looking sod/grass. I’m assuming since we didn’t have a “Sean” working on our property, we’ve gotten the short end of the stick.

If we had to do it over again, we wouldn’t. Starting with the initial person of contact for the build.

Let us know what Davidson’s plans are to rectify this situation.

I must note that Ana has been the most positive experience that I’ve had with Davidson thus far. I appreciate her customer service, communication, and willingness to help. I only wish that she’d been the realtor (I do know that she’s not a realtor) and that Sean had been the project manager when we started this venture.

Regards,
DZ

This is the email that I sent to Davidson Homes and no one has reached out to us to discuss or to resolve the issues.  Davidson has treated us more like an inconvenience than as customers. We should’ve backed out of the deal when we initially started working with the realtor to build our plan but we went against our better judgement. Our options were not explained at all, nor were they laid out for us as they were for others in other Davidson builds. We were brushed off when we asked for details about upgrades or options. This has led us to make decisions based off of a lack of information and available options. The sod that they laid was ridiculous and they would not help us to get our grass up to part as they did for all of our neighbors. Unfortunately for us, we were the first to purchase and to move into our neighborhood and we’re paying for it in the end. Davidson has put more care and concern in the neighboring homes and not putting any effort in meeting our needs today. Our master bedroom and bath stays very humid and hot and we have no explanation or understanding as to why it’s that way. It feels like we’re walking into the garage or the attic at times.

We’re very disappointed in our new investment.

Hi Daphne,

First, Debra was good. She was very prompt and communicative whenever I had a question. My only complaint was that she pointed out the ethernet in the model home as a selling point (or maybe I just noticed them and commented on it), but the actual ports are not installed in your home (just pre-wired) because "everyone uses wifi these days". This should have been brought up during the design meeting, but since it wasn't, I'm having to wire up my own connections. Not a big deal, just slightly annoying.

The bigger issue (more a problem with Heritage Mortgage) is if you're doing a VA loan, Davidson Homes / Heritage Mortgage will lie to you. They consider any VA non-allowable fees (borrower CAN'T pay) that the seller pays instead, to be a seller concession that counts toward their $3000 concession for using their services. So fees I'm not allowed to pay are somehow a "concession" to me. Total BS that cost me about $900. Good thing they had me fill out their survey prior to closing, because I left them a good review. I'd fill it out completely differently now.

name: Krystal Junge
text:
First off, a misrepresentation of how the back yard would be.  Was told a full sod back yard and the back yard has at least 4 large trees, 1 of which is a giant pine tree with limbs hanging over the house, one cluster of 12 small ones, and another cluster of 5 or so.  We asked them to let us cut the small ones and they cut the pine tree.  They told us no and we would have to wait until closing...WHEN THE BRAND NEW HOUSE IS UP!  We also explained to them that sod will not live under all of that shade, but they don’t care because they aren’t the ones going to live there!   Chantae lied and said the backyard would be bigger than the model home, well that might be, but a jungle was not what was represented!  She first said she didn’t say that at all, then later said it was taken out of context.  They are all out to cover their own behinds.

Now the windows are in, we noticed that the front window has grids.  We requested no grids at the design meeting.  We asked about it today, they said that the front window having grids is standard and there would have had to been an up charge to have no grids on that window.  This was NEVER mentioned before when we requested to have NO GRIDS.  Logan with Davidson Homes told us we can just go to Wilson Lumber when the house is closed on and buy a new  insert without grids and pop the glazing bead out to change it out ourselves. Once again taking no responsibility for it themselves.  Customer service isn’t even in their vocabulary.  And if you think they care that you aren’t happy....let me tell you, you are WRONG!!!!  Stay away from this company at ALL COST!!!  I was a trim and remodel carpenter for 8 years and now own my own home improvement company, and throughout all of the years I have never seen a contractor care so little about the homeowner!

name: Keith Matthews
text:

Be Warned!! A home warranty means nothing to Davidson Homes. We’ve had a leaky shower for over a year and it’s still hasn’t been repaired. Not to mention the electrical and other issues. text:
We have been in our home for 18 months now with very minimal issues all handled in a very timely manner.

From the time we started looking, we let Kevin know we were about a year away from buying. He still took the time to answer any and all questions we threw his way. He was a great help when we finally were able to build our retirement home from start to finish.

Blake was a great help in getting us move in ready after our brand new home was hit by the hail storm just days before our closing date. He worked to get all the repairs done in a timely manner with all the damage that was done to all the homes in our subdivision. He has never hesitated to stop and answer any question we have had as he drives by checking on other homes in our subdivision.

Within the 12 month warranty period, we had very minor issues come up. Just the normal little new home issues, a tile issue at the back door, a carpet issue, and a dishwasher issue. All of which were handled promptly by Logan in the warranty department.

Logan has also been a tremendous help in getting a drainage issue taken care of in the backyard of our home as well as our neighbors, that's wasn't just a Davidson Homes issue. It has involved the city, as well as the developer.  We can't thank Logan enough for the professional way he has handled himself with all the complaints being thrown his way from all of us involved in the issue for over a year now.

All in all, we are very pleased with our home.

resp.text:

text: I did not buy a home, nor do I have any idea what the quality of their construction is.  However, I did attempt to buy a home from them in their Hearthstone subdivision. name: Ben Webster
text:
PROS: Recently moved into one of the Jayden plans in Terrace at Savannah. Out of all their models, I think it has the best and most affordable floor plan. I really enjoyed the experience of being able to choose all the colors and our new home consultant Chantae did an amazing job at providing her input and answering any questions we had. We also chose to use Davidson’s provided realtor (which is free) and the realtor was super helpful (USE THEIR REALTOR). She updated us on the progress of the house and took videos and pictures. For the most part, everything was smooth and easy... almost too easy. The construction manager, Jerry, was very helpful and took his time to insure the house was closed and finished in a timely manner, all while insuring the tegrity and quality of the house was up to par.

CONS: We visited the house several time to insure changes we made were being implemented. (Took the advice from another review and I’m glad we did.) There were several key features and changes we had asked for that were being overlooked on the addendum. I think the root of the issue was due to our construction managers changing, however be mindful if you do have a lot of add-on and changes, try and check up on the house once a week or so.

WHAT I WOULD CHANGE: There were things that I feel should be standard that weren’t such as: numbers on the house other than just on the mailbox, a garbage disposal, gutters, and window screens (all can be added for extra cost).  There should be a choice as to what the “plant package” includes. The randomization is pretty... random and the plants were basically dead by move in time.

In all, the experience with Davidson was fun and exciting. You can tell that the people you work with along the way really care about their job and about you. I’d definitely use Davidson again given they had more unique plans to choose from in the future.

resp.text:
Hi Ben,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We value your feedback and appreciate your comments above! Thank you for allowing us to build your dream home.

-The Davidson Homes team

name: T Kelton
text: This company has made building my forever home a horrible experience. Because of Davidson Homes I will spend Christmas 2018 sleeping on someone's floor instead of in the new home I contracted to have built. Why? Because the contractor blames the city of Madison instead of admitting they tried to take shortcuts.  My original completion date was suppose to be in October. Then a closing date was set for Nov 12. A few days before closing I received a call telling me the backyard failed engineering inspection due to flooding. This was an issue that I had asked about before I purchased the property and asked about during the building process after visiting the site when it rained. I was told it was "OK" Then the home would not pass inspection. Davidson let the property sit for over a month with no work being done. I was told they would put a retention wall in November by Jake Blagburn.  After extending my monthly lease on my apartment 3 times I was forced to move out or pay more than double rent because I was month to month. I contacted the Sales manager Lou Paratore at Davidson and asked to help put me up in lodging. He flat out said "NO" you have to pay to live somewhere. Which is true. Yet Davidson Homes cannot give me a date as to when the home I gave them a down payment would be ready.!He then explains that work would began maybe the week before Christmas and maybe the home would be done sometime in January. I am offered no compensation only apologies. Yet for Christmas and New years I am sleeping on the floor on a air mattress while paying for storage. This company has not treated me fair and Lou Partore is very smart mouthed and disrespectful. All I have asked for is to move into the home I have a contract on and help with lodging. My only source of income is Social Security Disability and Veterans Disability and I cannot afford to pay for hotel when they cannot even give me a date that they will done.

text: I lived in downtown Auburn, renting from Badger Properties.  Without a doubt, it was one of the best rental companies that I have used in Auburn.  Apartment complex was very well maintained. name: J. Keith Maxwell
text: I stayed in Center Court this summer for a temporary situation. I had top notch service from Chris Kearns and Jason at Badger Properties. I would highly recommend Badger if you're looking for a quiet place to study or just to live. His rental policy is great for older students. Also, the customer service is superb.

name: Amanda Weaver-Laird
text:
My experience with Chris as a landlord and Badger Properties has been nothing short of an excellent experience. I moved to Auburn 2.5 years ago for my job in property management and have only lived on properties that I worked at. When I decided to move away from my student housing property I wanted to move somewhere that was close enough to campus that I could walk for game days, but that wasn't full of young students and this was the perfect place (Park Hill cottage). It was secluded and quiet, but just a walk away from downtown and all the fun that Auburn has to offer. The biggest downfall for this property was that there is no dishwasher (not a huge deal), no washer/dryer (but there is a laundry mat on site and down the street at Thatch Hut) and it has cinder block walls so it gets really cold in the winter.

I made the decision a few months ago to move to another newly renovated apartment that Chris also managed (Broadway Apartments) that were a few minutes farther down the road. I was so excited about the price and the location is still great, a littler farther from downtown but the apartment is so worth it! The renovations that Chris did are great, I love the flooring, paint colors, it had new carpeting and the room and closet sizes are great, it also comes with a (very small) dishwasher and a washer/dryer. The only issue that I have with this apartment is the amount of noise that I can hear from the people upstairs. Maybe keep the dogs on the 1st floor! ;-)

Chris has been a great landlord and I would absolutely recommend him to any serious students or young professionals looking to be in a great place in Auburn.

name: ASHLEY MURPHREE
text: Badger Properties is a diamond in the rough when it comes to realty companies in a college town. During my four years at Auburn, I used four different realtors. Badger Properties was by far the best! Chris, the owner, is a very kind and respectful business owner! He does not allow freshmen to lease at any of the properties, which is great for studying. I lived in the complex on W. Glenn, which was great because I was able to walk anywhere that I wanted to go (including class and the library)! You will not regret renting from Badger Properties!

name: Clay Grisetti
text:
If you need a place to stay in the Auburn area contact Badger Properties. Myself, the best man at my wedding, my sister, and many of my friends have been incredibly impressed with Chris Kearns and his locations.

Extremely fast repair or response time if you need anything. Friendly management that does a great job taking the worry out of renting.

If you enjoy Auburn life you can find Chris around campus, town, and even at Sporting Events across state lines.

My wife and our families have moved away from Auburn now but we have recommended Badger to many students and professionals and everyone has the same thoughts: if you need a place to stay, call Chris at Badger Properties.

name: Ashley L.
text: Probably one of the most humiliating rental experiences I've ever had as a renter. I went to Badger Properties because I read good reviews on Google and had heard generally good things from people. I went to the office in person and told Chris "the badger" my situation. I was just getting out of a 12 month rehab program, and had been working for a Christian Ministry and looking for an apartment in Auburn since I was a student at Auburn University at the time. I was very up front about my bad credit but was working 7 days a week and had many references etc to back up that I was honest and good for the rent every month. After seeing me alone in his office after hours, and asking me to come along (still alone) with him to see one of the properties (still after hours) I agreed because I was desperately in need of an apartment. He took me to an apartment to collect rent from a girl around my age, then he took me to another apartment where he basically showed me a place and then just sort of "visited" with some tenants. Every one seemed to like him, the apartments were pretty nice for how old they are, regardless, I was impressed at the time. We then went back to his office (once again, all happening after business hours) and he gave me an application, but before he did that he sat me down in the seating area of his office. We were completely alone and it was very dimly lit, and the front door was locked. He asked me extremely probing and personal questions about my past drug use. Mind you, I was sober for over a year at this point, active in church (still am) and admittedly hadn't even smoked a cigarette in over a year. He asked me questions like, "So what led you to do drugs?" "what kind of drugs have you tried?" "how did you do your drugs? did you shoot up? snort them?" He just kept asking SO many invasive and frankly, inappropriate questions; it was almost sadistic. I answered them as honestly as possible without divulging too much, because I really needed an apartment, I was impressed by the ones he had shown me and I thought that being as honest as I could would show him that I was a good tenant despite my bad credit, etc. After filling out an application and getting my credit checked through the program he said he uses to run credit (which gave a very vague summary of ones credit) I went back to his office once I had submitted my credit report and application. He said he didn't think he could rent to me because my credit report showed that I was $25k in debt; I explained that those were my student loans and that the program he uses wasn't showing exactly WHAT the debt was, just the amount. He said he couldn't rent to someone who was that far in debt. I explained that I am a student and that those are my student loans. I said, I would get a more in depth credit report and bring it to him. He gave me back my money order with the application fee on it and said to come back with a new credit report. My aunt is a real estate agent and she ran my credit for me, this time I had a complete credit report with every single student loan showing in detail, but because I had now ran my credit twice in one week, my already poor credit score was even lower. Despite that I went back to "the badger" and told him that the large amount of "debt" he saw was indeed my student loans, which were not even in collection because I was still attending Auburn at the time. He said then said he couldn't rent to someone with a credit score as low as mine and with a history like mine (due to my past drug use I had a criminal record. I have not had a single run in with the law in almost 4 years). So all in all, after wasting time, money, energy and being thoroughly humiliated, I would say that Badger Properties only serves those they deem worthy, and they don't believe in giving people second chances, only sadistically probing and dissecting the past of people who have made mistakes despite turning their lives around. A huge waste of time.

resp.text:
After 15 years of running Badger Homes and Badger Properties, I stand by my record of treating all applicants fairly in terms of their qualifications for an apartment.  They area 1) Credit score, from a tenant or direct relative, 2) Academic progress, and 3) good references from their previous landlord.  As stated above, our screening reports DO only show a credit score, they do not show a full report - meaning, we don't know the type of debt.  Our screening criteria is designed to approve or deny based on the SCORE, regardless of the type of debt.

If this dispute ever got serious, *I could produce a chain of emails which would explain and clearly show the reason for Denial*.  There was never any "trade" or "back door" approval process offered, and their never has been since I started the business.  We document every case of approval or denial, so we are ready to defend against accusations such as these.  That is not how we operate.  To have one negative review in 15 years should be evidence of how we do things.  Are we perfect?  No.  But we don't run the kind of business we are being accused of in the allegations above.

On the rehab comment: I can confidently say that we have rented to people coming from / still in rehab programs.  We have also rented to gay, straight, and many different religions and ethnic backgrounds, as well as singles, married couples, singles with kids, and families.  We have rented to people with low credit scores, also, but they must have a direct relative with a qualifying score be screened and sign as a Guarantor for their lease.  Our records are clear on that as well.  The "second score" that was brought to me to qualify was well below our minimum qualification.  We require a 650, the score presented was well below 600.

As stated above, there was not a qualifying score, and possibly not the required academic progress - but maybe
she met that qualification, I honestly do not recall.  We do not search any Applicant's criminal record, only our employees.

As stated above, I DID refund the Application Fee, and provide a true explanation of the reason for denial.  I do not remember asking questions about shooting or snorting drugs - I don't even know enough about drugs to know what that would mean anyway.  I have never even had a beer in my life, which everyone I've known for 41 years can verify.

After hours, most (not all) of the lights are off in our storefront office, and the door is usually locked, but it is a full glass storefront on a busy street full of shoppers - so hardly a threatening or scary place.  I admit I probably asked questions that I didn't officially need to ask, true.  I am sorry if doing so had a worse impact than I expected.

I do remember that the reviewer above and I did go to see an apartment and collect rent from a neighbor, but in most cases our rent is paid online, and has been for years.  I always thought that giving tours after hours and visiting with tenants after hours was a sign of good customer service, not something I would have to defend later.

If an independent auditor surveyed all of our current and previous tenants - male and female - over the last 15 years, they would come up with a conclusion that we are a little slow on maintenance, tough on noise, but that's about it.  If they surveyed everyone that has applied and that we have turned down over the last 15 years, they would find that there was a clear reason for each denial, and it was based on our written requirements of Credit Score, Academic Progress, and References.  That's it.  There is no evil, juicy story to report.

Ashley applied to rent from Badger in Sept 2014 for a Dec 14 opening..  I admit, I could have done better with the questions or the office lighting(?), but I have made no further attempt to contact her or to be in her life in any way beyond the Application period.  I am not sure why in April of 2016 she has decided to bring these accusations/allegations.

You have a right to a free copy of the report and to dispute the completeness of accuracy of any information in the consumer report with the consumer-reporting agency.

name: Justin Forbes
text:
If negative 5 stars was an option, I would choose that. David Watts is a property manager there who blatantly violated my rights under the Alabama Uniform Residential Landlord and Tenant Act as well as several articles of his own professional code of ethics as a Certified Property Manager. If you want to receive the respect you deserve as a tenant and have your rights upheld, do yourself a favor and never rent from this company.

Hi Michael,

It's nice to hear your rationalizations in defense of your younger brother's behavior, but I am more interested in the opinions of the Jefferson County Court of Law and the IREM ethics board.

resp.text: Mr. Forbes, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns and your lease, we have determined that there have been no violations of the Alabama URLTA or the professional Code of Ethics to which our company adheres. Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your wife (Ms. Galang) and our office, we attempted to schedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your wife would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by both parties (including third-party contractors unrelated to our company), this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission under the Alabama URLTA. Upon entering the premises, multiple other lease violations were then noted, including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your wife.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have rights under Alabama URLTA. After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage were enforced. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid further miscommunications.

text: Great people, committed to doing a good job

name: gcouogluhgit.Jasmine vWilliams
text: Very unprofessional! I started out renting a home from them then one day out the blue they sold the home.. Like are you serious I pretty sure selling wasn't last minute for them so why not let me know as well. Not only that the people they sold to tried to jack up my rent and never fixed anything!

resp.text:
Ms. Williams,

We appreciated you as a Tenant during your time with us.  However, we do not appreciate the 1 star and misplaced Google review.  Please recognize the following points.

1)	Watts Realty does not own property.  We manage for many different third parties.  Your lease document would have the name of the Landlord when it was under our management.
2)	Investment properties are sold in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot control our Clients’ decision to sell their own property(ies).   Sometimes Watts Realty isn’t involved with the sale transaction, only to receive notice the day of a sale.
3)	Investment sales fall through in the normal course of business every day across the globe.  We cannot notify Tenants of the numerous potential transactions, especially when many never coming to fruition.  Due diligence periods extend to the date of Closing in many, many cases.
4)	The property in which you reside was sold over 18 months ago in May of 2016.  We promptly notified you of the sale, and have not been associated with that property since May of 2016.
5)	Due to this Google review, we contacted your Landlord just to inquire about the situation. We have no involvement or contribution with your problems with your Landlord.  We do not manage the property, nor are they a Client of Watts Realty. Please do not misplace your frustration on us. You need to work with your Landlord to resolve those issues.

name: Cris Galang
text: DO NOT RENT HERE. THEIR LOW STAR RATING SAYS IT ALL. These are horrible people who treated me and my husband with such disrespect. It seems like they are nice to you if you let them manage your property but they treat renters differently. It took them 3 weeks to repair leak from upstairs shower (obviously not emergent to them, didnt even bother following up the first week if the plumber they hired came and did the job). Then persisted in entering our home without prior notice even when we explicitly didnt give them permission to do so, clearly a violation of our privacy.

resp.text: Ms. Galang, we appreciate you taking the time to rate our company and provide a review.  After reviewing your concerns, we have determined that there have been no violations of your privacy outside of the lease terms you agreed to adhere by. After you reported the leak on Sunday, May 27, during the Memorial Day weekend, the leak was assigned to a third-party contractor for completion. Regrettably, the shower drain requires a special tool to repair and the contractor did not have such tool available at the time they were on the property on May 27 (the same day you reported the leak). Based on the documented emails and telephone calls between you, your husband (Mr. Forbes) and our office, we attempted to reschedule the shower leak repair multiple times during a time when you or your husband would be present. Unfortunately, due to several miscommunications by the parties involved, this leak was elevated to an emergency status that would allow access to be granted without your presence and/or permission as per the terms of your lease. We entered your premises on June 8, less than two weeks after you reported the leak, to complete the repair by the contractor while being supervised by one of our employees. After we entered your premises, several lease violations were then noted - including the presence of multiple breeds of pets that previously were not disclosed by you or your husband.  We understand your concern about our respect for our residents and their rights; however, the owners of the property also have a responsibility and rights to protect their property (and your home). After an extended period of time not being able to schedule a time when all parties could be present, the owner’s rights to protect the property from continued damage from the leak were enforced - which triggered other property rights issues that we are attempting to work with you for you to bring into compliance with the terms of our lease. We do appreciate your tenancy since mid-May 2018 and apologize that our relationship has degraded in the short time you have been a resident in Alabama. Hopefully, we may be able to better serve you in the future and avoid any further miscommunications or lease violations.

text: Was VERY uncomfortable with the request for my credit card information to view property! All other realtors gave lockbox code or met us for showing. The property and neighborhood was mediocre at best. Scammers??

resp.text: We utilize an automated showing system called Rently for the convenience of prospective tenants on the go and don't have the time to schedule a walk through with our residential property manager.  The credit card information is for security purposes to verify your identity.  It is only a $0.99 charge that allows you access to up to 20 homes that utilize the Rently system or 30 days, whichever comes first.   If you do not feel comfortable using your credit card, please call us and let us know that is the case and we can provide you access by gathering additional identifying information from you.  If you want to walk through with an agent, please call us and schedule a time to do so.  I hope that clears up any confusion.

name: Stephen Davis
text:
If you are looking for a high quality built home constructed on time by honest people who work for a company with integrity, then do not choose Signature Homes at Brock Point. From the first interaction we had until the most recent as of yesterday, the employees at Brock Point have been dishonest with us. Once they lock you in through their deceitful sales tactics you are along for a horrible ride.

We were told 7-8 months from Contract to Close (possibly 6). After revised dates after revised dates it now stands at 11 1/2 months to Close. All we keeping getting from Signature Homes is they are behind schedule with no recovery plan or attempt to make up any time. They continue to work on spec homes while people who have Contracts wait. This occurred with many people in Brock Point and continues.

The amount of quality issues has been enormous. From plumbing being placed in the wrong location in the slab (required jacking up the floor) to retaining walls being poured too high to the house being painted the wrong color, it has been a comedy of errors. The framing was a complete QC nightmare with more issues than I can type. We can only imagine what’s left to come.

There aren’t many choices in the Hoover School District to build a new home. However, we suggest looking long and hard at other subdivisions. It is possible other Signature Homes subdivisions aren’t this bad, but is unlikely given the people we have spoken to and conducted meetings with control the overall company. Good luck to all those that still have homes to build with Brock Point!

EDIT: We officially moved in 2 weeks ago after 11 1/2 months from Contract. There is a already a leak above our Master Bedroom and our ceiling is ruined. I can't wait to see how the repair goes. Also, we have a list of 50+ warranty items that need addressing.

name: Jason Mardis
text: Been over 6 months and we still have unresolved issues from our walkthrough. When we have scheduled times for them to show up to work on those issues, not only do they not show up, they do not notify us they are not showing up. We are also the ones having to reach out to reschedule. Overall, a very poor experience. I would not recommend buying a home from signature, very poor customer service, especially since they push their warranty as a selling point.

name: Andrew Scarborough
text: As part of our HOA Board I experienced firsthand, this company’s consistently bad communication(not answering emails), inattentive management style, and disrespect from the owner of this company.  We often had to wonder who was managing who, because basic issues that should be easily addressed required repeated follow-up with you to make sure it got done.  For example, one of our condo owners had to actually drive to the post office to pick up their mail for close to two months because mail carriers would no longer deliver mail to a box that had no door and we couldn’t get this company to address getting the mailbox replaced in a timely manner.  The disrespect from this company’s owner came in the form of talking down to other board members and owners via email, hanging up on our board president during a phone call, and skipping a yearly board meeting to go to Tuscaloosa when he knew the main purpose of it was to get specific answers from him about the problems we were having as a property.  Fortunately, we’ve found another management company that doesn’t give us any of these problems and we are just beginning to recover financially.  I hope this review will help other people avoid the same problems and stress we had as property owners.

resp.text: Hello Andrew. Can you please give me some feedback on what caused the 1 star review?

name: Christopher Renda
text: Terrible Communication. It is physically impossible to get in touch with anyone. I honestly would like to find out how to get out of this Property Management Group without having to move from my home as we love it here. You will receive letters in the mail for changes to policy and/or violations and when you try to follow up you will receive no response. As a first time homeowner, this seems to be a very poorly managed HOA and I hope that all Home owners association groups do not operate in this way.

resp.text: Christopher: I apologize for the inconvenience you may have experienced. Please call the office and let me know how I can help personally.

name: John Higginbotham
text: First; I will update this review if it triggers a retaliatory response from this company. This company does not care about people. I say this from an experience I have had during this Covid-19 pandemic. After being laid off, this company refused to waive a late fee of $50.00 and an “admin” fee of $25.00 for its HOA fee assessment from not paying on time. Under normal circumstances, this would be expected, however, during a pandemic, you would think a company would be a little more understanding and naturally help those affected by this virus. This is why people dislike HOA companies. They seemed to be filled with hateful people that just want to make someone’s life hard because they are unhappy. Tread carefully when looking at properties run by Southern Property Management.

name: Christen Edwards
text: Very disappointed with this company. I signed the contract to build. I was initially supposed to have my pre-construction meeting in January. Unfortunately, my family had an unexpected death the same week and had to reschedule. The next available appointment wasn’t until February. After I had the pre-construction meeting with the construction manager, I received and signed the meeting notes that had the “pricing” based on the selections made. I received an email over a week later notifying me that because I had to reschedule the pre-construction meeting my construction date had to be pushed out and the price of the house increased by over $30,000! So now I am back at square one looking for my next home.  This just may be my blessing in disguise. If a company doesn’t see you for more than a dollar, then maybe they don’t deserve my money.  I’m truly shocked and disappointed by the lack of empathy shown given the situation. I’ll never recommend anyone to this builder just based on this experience alone. I’ve heard of nightmare stories, but I never imagined this would really happen. I get that companies are in the business to make a profit, but I do not believe that in less than a month the price we agreed to per our signed contract should have increased by over $30,000. I understand that there is an influx in this market however you don’t tell me a week after sending me documents to sign (which I did) that my contract is null and void due to market demands. It’s really devastating that a company that has built its reputation on people and prides itself on the best interest of the customer would do just the opposite. They violated our trust and have shown that they have no integrity. What was meant to be an unforgettable positive experience of homeownership is now a reality of uncertainty and anxiety simply because we believed this “reputable” company would stand by its word.

resp.text: We regret we had to do this as well.  We put the price escalation clause in your agreement to protect both Murphy Homes and our customers.  Current market conditions are causing incredibly difficult labor and material shortages.  Our cost inflation is so aggressive that we simply cannot build a home we are proud of without agreeing to nearly weekly increases in material and labor.  The revised price we offered was well below our current sales price.  For what it is worth, It was also below our breakeven price.  Again, we sincerely regret this happened and we hope you find a new home that fits your needs.  Thank you for considering us.

name: C B
text:
The selection process was pretty straight forward and simple. It was nice having a decent number of choices and Charlie/Cindy helped a bunch answering questions and suggestions.

As a whole, we still love our house and the neighborhood. It's a great location, nice neighbors, quiet, and will be a great place to raise our family.

On the house itself, during and after build, quite a bit of poor quality work kept being attempted to be passed off as normal.

Limited quality control appeared to be performed. There were obvious issues that they just ignored; mostly cosmetic but some big ones too with outlets (see below).

It was known this was our first home purchase and I really feel they tried to take advantage of that. Instead of doing things right, they appeared to cut some corners and I guess hope we wouldn't notice or know any better.

It is disappointing when, based on reviews, it seemed like it'd be a stress free and streamlined process from a local company.

Some of the good stuff:
- Working with Cindy on selections was great. She really helped get things in order. Same with the Richards lighting folks who were great as well.

- We really like the flooring (Cindy really helped out with us picking them!). Wolde did a good job making it look good.

- Overall we love the kitchen. They did an extended counter/cabinets and moved pantry shelves to the large side closet instead. Got plenty of counter space with lots of storage - exactly what we wanted.

Example of issues:

- Improper outlet installations. Backstab connections on most, box recessed too far and mounted incorrectly (exposed drywall screws through box into stud), and drywall screws to attach outlet to boxes.

- Bad outlet cutouts. Large chunks of drywall missing and tried to hide it with plate covers. Some of the holes were even outside the plates.

- Ceiling drywall seams are very noticeable with bumps, tape edge, etc visible. For open plan and this lighting, a higher level drywall finish was needed.

- Venthood was originally installed with no seal to the attic, just left open. They did come and spray foam up in it to seal it but should have been addressed by MH checks.

- Stove is different model than what we ordered. Nobody called to let us know original not available anymore - it was a slide in, this one is free standing. Had I known I would have changed to a cooktop (prefer stoves with overhanging tops which this one is not).

Edit:
Dropping to 1 star due to behavior of sub-contractors. Electrician walked in arguing, wouldn't listen to any concerns, everything was fine even if another electrician said it wasn't - and I have their report.

If you feel someone is wrong, discuss it and show why. Don't step into the house with an attitude unwilling to even listen to customer concerns.

resp.text: Hey Chris, we will keep working with you until we get these items cleared up.  Thank you for the feed back and hopefully we will have those negative items turned into positives very soon!

name: Milner Hanahan
text: We chose Murphy Homes to build our home for the reputation they have for quality construction and the recommendation of our realtor, the price point, and the onsite realtor Stephen was very helpful in finding us the right floor plan and giving us information about Murphy Homes and was easy to work with. We had never built a home so we really didn't know what to expect but are very satisfied with our home. Once you pick out your floor plan and lot that you are going to build on you get to meet with Cindy who is the design coordinator. This is really fun and one thing that separates Murphy Homes from most builders. With Cindy's help you get to design your home from many different options, so you can customize your home the way you want and Cindy is very helpful and fun to work with. The build took about 6 months and was relatively easy, and any issues were resolved by the owner Charlie and the realtor Stephen. The service we received from Cindy, Stephen, Charlie, and the contractor Clay were fantastic. If you are looking for a quality custom home with a reasonable price point with great people to work with I highly recommend checking out Murphy Homes.  We built in 2018 but my review was removed.

name: Northern Viking
text: Many of locations included Louisville @ 4301 Crowne Springs  Dr Rental Office does not have most current apartment availability posted on it website. On their web-site it says everything is available but when some one drives 125 mile and check accrual availability in person, only 1-2 apartment available but within 2-3 weeks notes only. This is not acceptable and misleading.  I wouldn't consider applying for any apartment with this company unless they fixed issue.

resp.text:
Thank you for your interest in Crowne. Our website, crownesummit.com, includes all of our floorplans for our community and does not list our availability. Some of our advertising partners, such as Apartments.com, include availability, however; they only update their system nightly and our availability can change in an instant if the apartment is leased or if there are scheduling changes in renovations. Please note this is true for all apartment communities on their site, so we strongly advise calling or emailing for current availability for your apartment home search. We currently have both one and two bedroom apartment homes available for immediate move in, but I do not believe it was the floor plan you were interested in. Please let us know if we can be of further assistance.

Sincerely,

Crowne Professional Management

name: Penelope Wallace
text: I'd give them 10 Stars! They're all amazing to work with, Jeannie is super friend and Josh has always been on point.  They've been nothing but helpful and accommodating in everyway.  I wish all rental managers were this awesome! Thanks for making Montevallo an awesome place!

text: Awesome folks! I don't know why anyone would ever complain about them!  They're timely and courteous and are always awesome to work with.

name: Apricot Pearson
text: Great folks- would highly recommend working with them.  They represent lots of good properties.

name: Jackson Pearson
text: I could not possibly agree more with the negative comments that I've read on here. I've lived in three of Bradford's properties over the last 10 years and have only positive things to say about them.  They're open Monday-Friday 9-5, just like their website says they are.  I will say that I've called within those hours and had to leave a message before but they've always called me back.  They have an email address for emergency maintenance which they've always been responsive to as far as I am concerned at least.  The people who work there are always polite and helpful.  I've had issues with bugs in the past as well but they sent an exterminator over for an extra spray a couple of times between the regular monthly spray and the issue was taken care of.  The guys who do their maintenance seem very nice.  They've surely never been rude or disrespectful.  I've had a couple of situations where they came to fix something and didn't have all of the parts the needed, so they had to leave and come back- once even hey had to order a part and it didn't come until the next day, but they seem to be qualified and have always made repairs that meet my standards.   I've surely never been made to feel as if they don't care about me or my issues.  I see them at least once per month to pay rents. I always have a delightful conversation with Jenny who works the front desk.  She is always kind to ask about my family and my life.  This business is very community oriented and involved in most every event that goes on in Montevallo.  I always see that they've sponsored little league and parades and festival and food drives.  I just can't imagine anything than that the people who have left negative comments created negative situations for themselves.  I'd even go so far as to say that this company goes above and beyond for their tenants.  Josh even came by to check on my heater one year on thanksgiving night because it had been giving me some issues that week.  anyone that is going to come out after hours and on a holiday just to make sure my family and I aren't cold is ok by me.  I'd give these people 10 stars if it was an option.

name: Christie Albergine
text: I️ had a great e patience with these people. I️ have to imagine for those that didn’t that it was their own fault.

name: Reckless Love
text: Applied for a rental house with a co-signer that was within my price range, paid the application fee, only for them to waste 3 day of my time after being told my the agent that there should be no problem getting approved. I constantly felt an air of discrimination from the front desk secretary. multiple times I was refused to speak with my agent. I was quoted a timeframe of 12 hours, it has been 3 days and they refuse to work with me. This company has lied to me, wasted my time, and now put me at a severe disadvantage with less than 24 hours to find a place to go. Gina is overall unpleasant to work with and Josh refuses to speak with clients. The power of approval is in a single mans hands (josh). there is no regulated system, but seemingly approving or denying basred of opinions of the person. the entire time I felt I was being pushed away and like they were trying to keep me out. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHOULD YOU GIVE THIS COMPANY YOUR BUSINESS.

name: Ouida Brackett
text: I called to deal with an issue of the company putting a check through on my account that was post dated. When I initially asked the front desk clerk if it would be okay to pay my 1st months rent,  and since I was there, give her a check for the upcoming months rent. I don't live in Montevallo and the property I was renting was in Alabaster. So since you can't pay rent online, I gave the post dated check so that I wouldn't have to drive back to Montevallo. I was assured TWICE by the clerk that this was okay. Fast forward after I paid my initial deposit as well as first month's rent. They decided to also deposit my post dated check for the upcoming month. Leaving me with an NSF due to the fact that the postdated amount wasn't accounted for in my monthly budget. ESPECIALLY after you already received $2,000 from me within a weeks time. I called and spoke with JOSH who verbally assaulted me and basically called me a criminal for writing bad checks. After he informed me that it's not their policy to take a post dated check and he doesn't know where I got that info from. I LITERALLY GOT IT FROM THE FRONT DESK  CLERK!!!! HE took no ownership, did not apologize, complained about a $50 fee he would have to pay b/c of my returned check and then hung up in my face. The crazy thing about this whole situation is that the check cleared on my end. My bank LITERALLY cleared the check and just charged me an NSF fee. All I wanted was my $30 back. He didn't even have the human decency to listen to what I was telling him before becoming beligerent!! This company is the absolute worst that I have ever dealt with in my life. And my husband is military so we have moved and dealt with numerous companies. RUN...DON'T WALK AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!!!!
